Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Shipment \Ship"ment\, n. 1. The act or process of shipping; as, he was engaged in the shipment of coal for London; an active shipment of wheat from the West. [1913 Webster]
2. That which is shipped. [1913 Webster]
The question is, whether the share of M. in the shipment is exempted from condemnation by reason of his neutral domicle. --Story. [1913 Webster]
shipment n 1: goods carried by a large vehicle [syn: {cargo}, {lading}, {freight}, {load}, {loading}, {payload}, {consignment}] 2: the act of sending off something [syn: {dispatch}, {despatch}]
